alert.note: Alert for Brown; Johnson; Morgan (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 8:20AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Morgan, southern Johnson and northern Brown Counties through 900 AM EDT... At 820 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Martinsville, or 22 miles south of Indianapolis, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of eastern Morgan, southern Johnson and northern Brown Counties, including the following locations... Mahalasville, Peoga, Morgantown, Waverly, Trafalgar, Spearsville, Princes Lakes, Centerton, Brooklyn, and Bargersville. This includes Interstate 65 between mile markers 87 and 90. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
